channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Military mobility plan to speed tanks and troops across Europe announced
item.description: European Commission seeks to ease rules on cross-border movements to create ‘military Schengen’ zone Europe live – latest updates The EU executive has...

item.title: Denmark announces one of the world’s most ambitious climate targets, while the rest of the EU looks away
item.description: Governments across the continent have attacked green rules with increasing ferocity – all while professing their commitment to existing climate target...

item.title: Wintry conditions to last in coastal areas after up to 7cm of snow fell in parts of UK
item.description: North Scotland and east and west coasts of UK to get wintry showers but conditions will be brighter and drier inland Wintry conditions are expected to...

item.title: Cop30 live: Brazil aims for early agreement on ‘big four’ issues
item.description: In an unorthodox move, the Brazilian organisers have hatched a plan to wrap up the trickiest topics at the climate summit by this evening, two days ea...

item.title: Death toll from Russian attack rises to 25 as Ukraine says it will raise issue at UN – Europe live
item.description: Ukraine to raise the overnight attack on Ternopil, in which more than 70 people were injured, at the security council tomorrow The Dutch economy minis...

item.title: Children among 25 killed in one of Russia's deadliest strikes on western Ukraine
item.description: Two blocks of flats were attacked in the western city of Ternopil. One was almost destroyed.

item.title: Australia cap Hughes called up by Wales
item.description: Wales call up Melbourne City midfielder Laura Hughes, who has been capped by Australia, for their international camp in Spain.

item.title: Supreme Court rules Christian-focused RE taught in NI schools is unlawful
item.description: The Christian RE taught in schools in Northern Ireland is unlawful, the UK Supreme Court has ruled.

item.title: Serial rapist and former police officer David Carrick guilty of more sex offences
item.description: David Carrick is already serving a life sentence for 71 offences of sexual violence.

item.title: Russian spy ship pointed lasers at RAF pilots tracking it, says defence secretary
item.description: John Healey says he has updated the Navy's rules for tracking the vessel after the "dangerous" move.
